verses.kjv: Now there were in the church that was at Antioch certain prophets and teachers; as Barnabas, and Simeon that was called Niger, and Lucius of Cyrene, and Manaen, which had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.
verses.ct: In the church at Antioch, there were prophets and teachers: Barnabas, Simeon (who was called Niger), Lucius from Cyrene, Manaen (who had grown up with Herod the tetrarch), and Saul.

verses.kjv: As they ministered to the Lord, and fasted, the Holy Ghost said, Separate me Barnabas and Saul for the work whereunto I have called them.
verses.ct: While they were worshiping the Lord and fasting, the Holy Spirit said, "Set apart Barnabas and Saul for me, for the mission I have called them to."

verses.kjv: And when they had fasted and prayed, and laid their hands on them, they sent them away.
verses.ct: After more fasting and prayer, they placed their hands on them and sent them off.

verses.kjv: So they, being sent forth by the Holy Ghost, departed unto Seleucia; and from thence they sailed to Cyprus.
verses.ct: Sent out by the Holy Spirit, the 2 of them went down to Seleucia and sailed from there to Cyprus.

verses.kjv: And when they were at Salamis, they preached the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews: and they had also John to their minister.
verses.ct: When they arrived in Salamis, they proclaimed God's word in the Jewish synagogues. John was with them as their assistant.

verses.kjv: And when they had gone through the isle unto Paphos, they found a certain sorcerer, a false prophet, a Jew, whose name was Barjesus:
verses.ct: They traveled across the whole island until they reached Paphos, where they encountered a Jewish sorcerer and false prophet named Bar-Jesus.

verses.kjv: Which was with the deputy of the country, Sergius Paulus, a prudent man; who called for Barnabas and Saul, and desired to hear the word of God.
verses.ct: He was an associate of the provincial governor, Sergius Paulus, an intelligent man. The governor sent for Barnabas and Saul because he wanted to hear God's word.

verses.kjv: But Elymas the sorcerer (for so is his name by interpretation) withstood them, seeking to turn away the deputy from the faith.
verses.ct: But Elymas the sorcerer (which is what his name means when translated) opposed them and tried to turn the governor away from the faith.

verses.kjv: Then Saul, (who also is called Paul,) filled with the Holy Ghost, set his eyes on him,
verses.ct: Then Saul, also known as Paul, filled with the Holy Spirit, looked directly at him

verses.kjv: And said, O full of all subtilty and all mischief, thou child of the devil, thou enemy of all righteousness, wilt thou not cease to pervert the right ways of the Lord?
verses.ct: and said, "You are full of every kind of deceit and fraud, you son of the devil, you enemy of everything that is right! Will you never stop twisting the straight paths of the Lord?"

verses.kjv: And now, behold, the hand of the Lord is upon thee, and thou shalt be blind, not seeing the sun for a season. And immediately there fell on him a mist and a darkness; and he went about seeking some to lead him by the hand.
verses.ct: "Right now, the Lord's hand is against you. You will be blind and unable to see the sun for a time." Immediately a fog and darkness came over him, and he stumbled around searching for someone to lead him by the hand.

verses.kjv: Then the deputy, when he saw what was done, believed, being astonished at the doctrine of the Lord.
verses.ct: When the governor saw what had happened, he believed, completely amazed by the teaching about the Lord.

verses.kjv: Now when Paul and his company loosed from Paphos, they came to Perga in Pamphylia: and John departing from them returned to Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Paul and his companions sailed from Paphos and arrived at Perga in Pamphylia. There John left them and returned to Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: But when they departed from Perga, they came to Antioch in Pisidia, and went into the synagogue on the sabbath day, and sat down.
verses.ct: From Perga they continued on to Antioch in Pisidia. On the Sabbath day they went into the synagogue and sat down.

verses.kjv: And after the reading of the law and the prophets the rulers of the synagogue sent unto them, saying, Ye men and brethren, if ye have any word of exhortation for the people, say on.
verses.ct: After the public reading from the Law and the Prophets, the synagogue leaders sent them a message: "Brothers, if you have any word of encouragement for the people, please speak."

verses.kjv: Then Paul stood up, and beckoning with his hand said, Men of Israel, and ye that fear God, give audience.
verses.ct: Paul stood up, motioned with his hand, and said, "People of Israel and all of you who are devoted to God, listen to me.

verses.kjv: The God of this people of Israel chose our fathers, and exalted the people when they dwelt as strangers in the land of Egypt, and with an high arm brought he them out of it.
verses.ct: The God of the people of Israel chose our ancestors. He made the people prosper during their stay as foreigners in Egypt, and with his mighty power he led them out of that land.

verses.kjv: And about the time of forty years suffered he their manners in the wilderness.
verses.ct: For about 40 years he put up with them in the wilderness.

verses.kjv: And when he had destroyed seven nations in the land of Chanaan, he divided their land to them by lot.
verses.ct: After he overthrew 7 nations in the land of Canaan, he gave their territory to his people as an inheritance.

verses.kjv: And after that he gave unto them judges about the space of four hundred and fifty years, until Samuel the prophet.
verses.ct: All of this took about 450 years. After that, he gave them judges until the time of the prophet Samuel.

verses.kjv: And afterward they desired a king: and God gave unto them Saul the son of Cis, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, by the space of forty years.
verses.ct: Then the people asked for a king, and God gave them Saul son of Kish, from the tribe of Benjamin, who ruled for 40 years.

verses.kjv: And when he had removed him, he raised up unto them David to be their king; to whom also he gave testimony, and said, I have found David the son of Jesse, a man after mine own heart, which shall fulfil all my will.
verses.ct: After removing Saul, God raised up David as their king. God spoke about him, saying, 'I have found David son of Jesse to be a man whose heart aligns with mine. He will carry out everything I want him to do.'

verses.kjv: Of this man’s seed hath God according to his promise raised unto Israel a Saviour, Jesus:
verses.ct: From David's descendants, God has brought to Israel a Savior — Jesus — just as he promised.

verses.kjv: When John had first preached before his coming the baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.
verses.ct: Before Jesus arrived, John preached a baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.

verses.kjv: And as John fulfilled his course, he said, Whom think ye that I am? I am not he. But, behold, there cometh one after me, whose shoes of his feet I am not worthy to loose.
verses.ct: As John was completing his mission, he kept saying, 'Who do you think I am? I am not the one you're waiting for. But pay attention — someone is coming after me whose sandals I am not even worthy to untie.'

verses.kjv: Men and brethren, children of the stock of Abraham, and whosoever among you feareth God, to you is the word of this salvation sent.
verses.ct: Brothers, descendants of Abraham, and all of you who are devoted to God — this message of salvation has been sent to us.

verses.kjv: For they that dwell at Jerusalem, and their rulers, because they knew him not, nor yet the voices of the prophets which are read every sabbath day, they have fulfilled them in condemning him.
verses.ct: The people living in Jerusalem and their leaders did not recognize Jesus. They didn't understand the words of the prophets that are read every Sabbath, and by condemning him they actually fulfilled those very prophecies.

verses.kjv: And though they found no cause of death in him, yet desired they Pilate that he should be slain.
verses.ct: Even though they found no legitimate reason to execute him, they asked Pilate to have him killed.

verses.kjv: And when they had fulfilled all that was written of him, they took him down from the tree, and laid him in a sepulchre.
verses.ct: After they had carried out everything that was written about him, they took him down from the cross and placed him in a tomb.

verses.kjv: But God raised him from the dead:
verses.ct: But God raised him from the dead.

verses.kjv: And he was seen many days of them which came up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who are his witnesses unto the people.
verses.ct: For many days he appeared to those who had traveled with him from Galilee to Jerusalem. These people are now his witnesses to the nation.

verses.kjv: And we declare unto you glad tidings, how that the promise which was made unto the fathers,
verses.ct: We are here to bring you this good news: the promise that God made to our ancestors

verses.kjv: God hath fulfilled the same unto us their children, in that he hath raised up Jesus again; as it is also written in the second psalm, Thou art my Son, this day have I begotten thee.
verses.ct: he has now fulfilled for us, their children, by raising Jesus. As it is written in the 2nd Psalm: 'You are my Son; today I have become your Father.'

verses.kjv: And as concerning that he raised him up from the dead, now no more to return to corruption, he said on this wise, I will give you the sure mercies of David.
verses.ct: Regarding the fact that God raised him from the dead, never to decay again, he said it this way: 'I will give you the faithful blessings promised to David.'

verses.kjv: Wherefore he saith also in another psalm, Thou shalt not suffer thine Holy One to see corruption.
verses.ct: That is why he also says in another Psalm: 'You will not let your Holy One experience decay.'

verses.kjv: For David, after he had served his own generation by the will of God, fell on sleep, and was laid unto his fathers, and saw corruption:
verses.ct: Now David served God's purpose in his own generation, then he died, was buried with his ancestors, and his body did decay.

verses.kjv: But he, whom God raised again, saw no corruption.
verses.ct: But the one God raised from the dead did not experience decay.

verses.kjv: Be it known unto you therefore, men and brethren, that through this man is preached unto you the forgiveness of sins:
verses.ct: So I want you to know, brothers, that through Jesus the forgiveness of sins is being announced to you.

verses.kjv: And by him all that believe are justified from all things, from which ye could not be justified by the law of Moses.
verses.ct: Through him, everyone who believes is made right with God — freed from everything that the law of Moses could never free you from.

verses.kjv: Beware therefore, lest that come upon you, which is spoken of in the prophets;
verses.ct: Be careful, then, that what the prophets warned about doesn't happen to you:

verses.kjv: Behold, ye despisers, and wonder, and perish: for I work a work in your days, a work which ye shall in no wise believe, though a man declare it unto you.
verses.ct: 'Look, you scoffers, be amazed and perish! For I am doing something in your days that you would never believe, even if someone explained it to you.'"

verses.kjv: And when the Jews were gone out of the synagogue, the Gentiles besought that these words might be preached to them the next sabbath.
verses.ct: As Paul and Barnabas were leaving the synagogue, the people urged them to speak about these things again the following Sabbath.

verses.kjv: Now when the congregation was broken up, many of the Jews and religious proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas: who, speaking to them, persuaded them to continue in the grace of God.
verses.ct: After the meeting broke up, many of the Jews and devout converts to Judaism followed Paul and Barnabas, who talked with them and urged them to continue living in God's grace.

verses.kjv: And the next sabbath day came almost the whole city together to hear the word of God.
verses.ct: On the next Sabbath, nearly the entire city gathered to hear the word of the Lord.

verses.kjv: But when the Jews saw the multitudes, they were filled with envy, and spake against those things which were spoken by Paul, contradicting and blaspheming.
verses.ct: When the Jewish leaders saw the crowds, they were consumed with jealousy. They argued against what Paul was saying, contradicting him and hurling insults.

verses.kjv: Then Paul and Barnabas waxed bold, and said, It was necessary that the word of God should first have been spoken to you: but seeing ye put it from you, and judge yourselves unworthy of everlasting life, lo, we turn to the Gentiles.
verses.ct: Then Paul and Barnabas spoke out boldly: "It was necessary for God's word to be spoken to you first. But since you are rejecting it and consider yourselves unworthy of eternal life, we are now turning to the Gentiles.

verses.kjv: For so hath the Lord commanded us, saying, I have set thee to be a light of the Gentiles, that thou shouldest be for salvation unto the ends of the earth.
verses.ct: For this is what the Lord has commanded us: 'I have made you a light for the Gentiles, so that you would bring salvation to the farthest corners of the earth.'"

verses.kjv: And when the Gentiles heard this, they were glad, and glorified the word of the Lord: and as many as were ordained to eternal life believed.
verses.ct: When the Gentiles heard this, they were overjoyed and praised the word of the Lord. Everyone who was appointed for eternal life became a believer.

verses.kjv: And the word of the Lord was published throughout all the region.
verses.ct: The word of the Lord spread throughout the entire region.

verses.kjv: But the Jews stirred up the devout and honourable women, and the chief men of the city, and raised persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and expelled them out of their coasts.
verses.ct: But the Jewish leaders stirred up the influential, God-fearing women and the leading men of the city. They incited persecution against Paul and Barnabas and drove them out of the area.

verses.kjv: But they shook off the dust of their feet against them, and came unto Iconium.
verses.ct: So Paul and Barnabas shook the dust off their feet in protest against them and traveled on to Iconium.

verses.kjv: And the disciples were filled with joy, and with the Holy Ghost.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, the disciples were filled with joy and with the Holy Spirit.
